Module kivakit.kernel
Package com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.progress.reporters

Class Progress

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.progress.reporters.Progress
All Implemented Interfaces:
Resettable, Receiver, Transmitter, NamedObject, ProgressReporter, Broadcaster, Transceiver
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConcurrentProgress
public class Progress extends Multicaster implements ProgressReporter
A progress reporter that sends progress messages to a Listener as an operation proceeds. Progress reporting on an operation is started with start(String). At each step, next() or next(long) should be called to report progress. When the operation is over end(String, Object...) should be called.

Example - Broadcasting Progress of an Operation 

 var progress = Progress.create(LOGGER, "bytes");
 progress.start("Downloading")
 while ([...])
 {
     [...]

     progress.next();
 }
 progress.end("Downloaded");

Example - Listening to the Progress of an Operation 

 progress.listener(percent -> System.out.println("$ complete", percent);
Progress is not thread-safe. To report progress in a multi-threaded operations, use ConcurrentProgress.
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • listener

      public Progress listener​(ProgressListener listener)
      Description copied from interface: ProgressReporter
      Calls a listener with the percent of progress each time it changes. This method is only called if ProgressReporter.steps() is larger than 0.
      Specified by:
      listener in interface ProgressReporter

    • next

      public void next()
      Description copied from interface: ProgressReporter
      Report the next step in the operation. This is often fine-grained such as processing a single node or way in a data file. The implementation in Progress of this interface is designed to be efficient in this way.
      Specified by:
      next in interface ProgressReporter
